parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the heater core can cause the windshield to fog up, reducing visibility while driving, and release antifreeze into the passenger compartment, potentially causing health problems. Additionally, the failure can lead to damage to other components, such as the transmission control device, and cause safety hazards.
symptoms: antifreeze smell in the passenger compartment

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the heater core can cause coolant to leak into the passenger compartment, leading to a sweet, antifreeze-like odor, fogging of windows, and potential health risks. This can also damage electrical components, including the automatic transmission computer, and may cause respiratory illnesses.
symptoms: especially when the heater is turned on; fogging of windows
including the front windshield; coolant leak onto floor mats
and electrical wiring inside the dashboard; respiratory illnesses.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical Component Damage due to Heater Core Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The leakage of coolant from the heater core can damage electrical components, including the automatic transmission computer, traction control system, and throttle control, which can lead to engine failure, loss of control, and potential accidents.
Accelerated wear on brake pads can lead to premature brake failure, increasing the risk of accidents and potentially causing loss of life.
symptoms: despite normal driving habits and no "riding the brakes".

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Warped brake rotors can cause vibrations, noise, and reduced braking performance, increasing the risk of accidents and potentially causing loss of life.
